title: Authors and Citation
text: William Denney. Author, maintainer. Tim Cacek. Data contributor.            Thanks Tim Cacek ContractKinetica providing anonymized datasets. Sibo Jiang. Data contributor.            Thanks contributing simulated PK data. Chanida Karnpracha. Data contributor. Kaori Ito. Data contributor.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Denney W (2023). PKdata: Pharmacokinetic Data Sets. https://github.com/billdenney/PKdata, https://billdenney.github.io/PKdata/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {PKdata: Pharmacokinetic Data Sets},   author = {William Denney},   year = {2023},   note = {https://github.com/billdenney/PKdata, https://billdenney.github.io/PKdata/}, }

title: Pharmacokinetic Data Sets
text: Pharmacokinetic data testing software real statically simulated data. target package cover different relevant types data multiple examples type data. Current examples include: Hydrocortisone simulated data sets illustrating oral dosing. CP1805 data illustrating multiple routes dosing compound. TC20160506 (real drug name) real data illustrating multiple doses occurring quick succession. KI20160914 (real drug name) adjusted data illustrating single dosing. Lipoic acid single-dose real data concentration time NCA parameters calculated Kinetica WinNonlin. Xanthohumol metabolite isoxanthohumol single-dose real data complex increases decreases concentration time NCA parameters calculated Kinetica WinNonlin.

title: Pharmacokinetics of CP1805 — CP1805
text: Pharmacokinetics CP1805

title: Pharmacokinetics of CP1805 — CP1805
Pharmacokinetics of CP1805 — CP1805
text: CP1805_conc de-identified data set concentration-time   data CP1805 data frame following variables: ID Subject identifier DAY Day measurement TIME_AFTER_DOSE Time since dose current DAY (hours) TIME Time since first dose DAY 1 (hours) TIMEU Units time, "hours" CONC Plasma concentration CP1805 (ug/mL) CONCU Units plasma concentration CP1805, "ug/mL" CP1805_dose de-identified data set dosing data   CP1805 data frame following variables: ID Subject identifier ROUTE Route administration DAY Day measurement TIME_AFTER_DOSE Time since dose current DAY (hours) TIME Time since first dose DAY 1 (hours) TIMEU Units time, "hours" DOSE Total dose CP1805 (mg) DOSEU Total dose CP1805, "mg" NDOSE Dose CP1805 normalized body weight (mg/kg) NDOSEU Units dose CP1805 normalized body weight, "mg/kg" CP1805_demog de-identified data set demographic data   CP1805 pharmacokinetics data frame following variables: ID Subject identifier SEX Subject's sex (Male/Female) WEIGHT Subject's body weight (kg) WEIGHTU Units subject's body weight, "kg" object class data.frame 320 rows 7 columns. object class data.frame 320 rows 10 columns. object class data.frame 20 rows 4 columns.

what:
Pharmacokinetics of an experimental compound reported in Table 4 of Holder
1999 — Holder_1999
title:
Pharmacokinetics of an experimental compound reported in Table 4 of Holder
1999 — Holder_1999
text: Observed data set concentration-time data experimental compound. data use sparse PK sampling "batch" design animal one sample full profile.

title:
Pharmacokinetics of an experimental compound reported in Table 4 of Holder
1999 — Holder_1999

Pharmacokinetics of an experimental compound reported in Table 4 of Holder
1999 — Holder_1999
text: Holder_1999_conc data frame describing concentration time following variables: ID Subject identifier TIME Time (hours) TIMEU Units time, "hr" CONC Plasma concentration experimental compound (ug/mL) CONCU Units plasma concentration, "ug/mL" Holder_1999_dose data frame describing dosing following variables: ID Subject identifier DOSE Dose (mg/kg) DOSEU Units nominal dose, "mg/kg" TIME Time start dose (minutes) TIMEU Units time, "minutes" ROUTE Route administration, "intravenous bolus" Holder_1999_demog data frame describing demographics following variables: ID Subject identifier SEX Animal sex (always "Female") SPECIES Species animal (always "rat") GROUP Arbitrary group number animal within dose level object class data.frame 108 rows 5 columns. object class data.frame 54 rows 6 columns. object class data.frame 54 rows 4 columns.

title:
Pharmacokinetics of an experimental compound reported in Table 4 of Holder
1999 — Holder_1999
text: Holder DJ, Hsuan F, Dixit R, Soper K. method estimating testing area curve serial sacrifice, batch, complete data designs. J Biopharm Stat. 1999;9(3):451-464. doi:10.1081/BIP-100101187

text: KI20160914_conc concentration-time data KI20160914.   data.frame following variables: ID Subject identifier PERIOD Period number different visits study TIME Nominal time since first dose DAY 1 current PERIOD (hours) TIME.FIRST.DOSE Nominal time since first dose PERIOD 1 (hours) DAY Study day (since beginning PERIOD 1 CONC Plasma concentration KI20160914 FORMULATION Formulation number KI20160914_dose dosing data.  data.frame   following variables: ID Subject identifier PERIOD Period number different visits study TIME Nominal time since first dose DAY 1 current PERIOD (hours) TIME_FIRST_DOSE Nominal time since first dose PERIOD 1 (hours) TIMEU Units time, "hours" DAY Study day (since beginning PERIOD 1 DOSE Dose KI20160914 (mg). FORMULATION Formulation number ROUTE Route administration KI20160914_demog demographic data KI20160914   pharmacokinetics.  data.frame following variables: ID Subject identifier AGE Subject's age (years) SEX Subject's sex (Male/Female) WEIGHT Subject's body weight (kg) object class data.frame 4904 rows 7 columns. object class data.frame 317 rows 9 columns. object class data.frame 159 rows 6 columns.
